page.title: 15TRANSPORT AT TEDSTONE
page.content: There are two roads in this area, one south to north from Whitbourne Ford to Clifton-upon-Teme and the other south to west from Whitbourne to Tedstone Wafre. The rest of the area is served by farm tracks, drive entrances etc. In a severe winter these roads are liable to be completely blocked by heavy snowfalls. There is no railway line and only one bus a week services the area except that two school buses take secondary school children to Bromyard and Worcester City. The main forms of transport are private cars, tractors and farm machinery.
